title: I Am: Divine Nature
body: Contemplate the beauty of your life as it is. In this short affirmational meditation, Ram Dass invites us to connect with the higher perspective of who we really are and your divine nature.
teaser: Contemplate the beauty of your life as it is.

title: Love: Constant in the Universe
body: How do we connect to love in every moment? With this short affirmatonal meditation, Ram Dass invites us to release pain, grief, and fear, and reminds us that it is always possible to feel love that is not limited, and this love is a constant in the universe.
teaser: How do we connect to love in every moment?  Ram Dass  reminds us that it is always possible to feel love that is not limited, and this love is a constant in the universe.

title: There is Only Us: Your Deepest Wisdom
body: Are you looking for meaning externally instead of discovering your deepest wisdom? Ram Dass offers a short affirmational meditation to invite us to  connect to the universal source which imbues our lives with meaning. Ram Dass guides us in connecting to this deeper wisdom of the universe.
teaser: Are you looking for meaning externally instead of discovering your deepest wisdom? Ram Dass guides us in connecting to this deeper wisdom of the universe.

title: Soul Business
body: In difficult times, it is challenging not to close our hearts to those around us. In this teaching from Ram Dass, we learn how keeping our hearts open to others means we are also open to universal love, as we connect from one soul to another.
teaser: In this teaching from Ram Dass, we learn how keeping our hearts open to others means we are also open to universal love, as we connect from one soul to another.

title: Fear and the Witness
body: Uncertainty can give rise to fear. In this affirmational meditation, Ram Dass speaks of how to progress past our fears, by witnessing and being here now. Through this practice of being present, we can better understand our individual roles within the universe.
teaser: Uncertainty can give rise to fear. In this affirmational meditation, Ram Dass speaks of how to progress past our fears, by witnessing and being here now.

title: The Art of Grief
body: Ram Dass explains that when we grieve, we realize that a dream is lost. The sadness we feel is how our identity is changed with that loss. In this inspiring affirmation, Ram Dass reminds us to accept the loss, and come to healing in time, seeing that we always have a place in the universe.
teaser: In this inspiring affirmation, Ram Dass reminds us to accept the loss, and come to healing in time, seeing that we always have a place in the universe.

title: Soul and Awakening
body: Awakening your soul to truth is a moment of freedom. In this teaching, Ram Dass explains that our tendency to attach to negative ideas about ourselves means that we may not see our soul's potential clearly. When we observe the world, unattached to the phenomena we see, then we are truly free.
teaser: In this teaching, Ram Dass explains that our tendency to attach to negative ideas about ourselves means that we may not see our soul's potential clearly. When we observe the world, unattached to the phenomena we see, then we are truly free.

title: Quiet Mind Open Heart
body: There are two processes in awakening our perception to compassion: a quiet mind and an open heart. In this teaching from Ram Dass, he describes how we can find freedom by coming back to the present moment and recognizing that we are not separate from the beauty of the universe around us.
teaser: There are two processes in awakening our perception to compassion: a quiet mind and an open heart.

title: The Purpose of Life
body: What is the highest purpose of your life on earth? Ram Dass teaches that we each have a choice to create our life’s path. Our soul is in a curriculum to learn from everything we see. We can change anything in the universe, he says, as long as we honor the experiences we have,  which purposefully shape who we are.
teaser: What is the highest purpose of your life on earth? Ram Dass teaches that we each have a choice to create our life’s path.

title: Humor and the Play of Form
body: Humor is a shifting of perspective. In this meditation on our human nature, Ram Dass explains how we can keep equanimity by maintaining lightness in our perceptions of people and events. He says that we are all at play in the game of life, and by maintaining a sense of humor you can observe the way life changes without being weighed down by your expectations.
teaser: Humor is a shifting of perspective. In this meditation on our human nature, Ram Dass explains how we can keep equanimity by maintaining lightness in our perceptions of people and events.

title: Hold On Tightly Let Go Lightly
body: The biggest fear of aging is the fear of death. In this affirmative meditation, Ram Dass helps to dispel the illusion of separateness that can bring balance to the fear and acceptance within. Learning to be in the moment and becoming open to the mystery of what comes next, enables us to transcend death and let go into the light.
teaser: In this affirmative meditation, Ram Dass helps to dispel the illusion of separateness that can bring balance to the fear and acceptance within.

title: Give Up Anger
body: Many of us have seen how easy it is to hold onto anger and let it be a feeling that rules our thoughts. This is something that Ram Dass is familiar with, too. He reflects back on his personal experience of learning to tell the truth about hating others, instead of loving them, and how this honesty opened his heart, enabling him to give up anger.
teaser: Many of us have seen how easy it is to hold onto anger and let it be a feeling that rules our thoughts. This is something that Ram Dass is familiar with, too.

title: Roles and Souls
body: Can we relate to others outside of the roles we play? In this affirmation, Ram Dass reminds us that we can identify with others beyond our roles to connect with our souls as beings who are on a deeply meaningful life journey. We are never alone on the path of life, and we are always in community (sangha) with others around us.
teaser: Can we relate to others outside of the roles we play? In this affirmation, Ram Dass reminds us that we can identify with others beyond our roles to connect with our souls as beings who are on a deeply meaningful life journey.

title: Absolutely Perfect
body: Who do you think you are? Ram Dass explains that your ideas about yourself change what you see within and the world around you. As you learn to observe every situation without expectation, you will find that you are always in an absolutely perfect moment.
teaser: Who do you think you are? Ram Dass explains that your ideas about yourself change what you see within and the world around you.

title: The Balancing Act
body: How can we be free from suffering? In this meditation, Ram Dass helps us to see that we can be joyful in the midst of suffering we experience, by doing what we can to be compassionate toward people who are also suffering. We can bring balance to our lives by reaching out with acts of service (seva) to others.
teaser: How can we be free from suffering? In this meditation, Ram Dass helps us to see that we can be joyful in the midst of suffering we experience, by doing what we can to be compassionate toward people who are also suffering.

title: No One Way
body: How do we reach our goals in our spiritual journeys? In this affirmational meditation, Ram Dass explains that you will be pulled to find the path that you need, and there is no single teacher can help you find your goal. The most essential goal, he says, is to continually listen to what is happening within yourself.
teaser: How do we reach our goals in our spiritual journeys? In this affirmational meditation, Ram Dass explains that you will be pulled to find the path that you need, and there is no single teacher can help you find your goal.

title: Components of Service
body: Handle every moment as a mystery, Ram Dass says. We must do our work in relating to one another without a thought for what will happen because of it. This is how we can be conscious without being consumed by worry. Mindful that each moment is where you are, not the past or the future.
teaser: Handle every moment as a mystery, Ram Dass says. We must do our work in relating to one another without a thought for what will happen because of it.

title: Ah, So
body: Do you want a mantra? Try “ah, so”. How can we feel at peace in an unstable world? Ram Dass teaches that we can ride the waves of change with an observational mind rather than a reactive mind. In this meditation, he shares the practice of accepting what arises by simply saying, “ah, so”.
teaser: How can we feel at peace in an unstable world? Ram Dass teaches that we can ride the waves of change with an observational mind rather than a reactive mind. In this meditation, he shares the practice of accepting what arises by simply saying, “ah, so”.

title: The Individual Human Heart
body: The basic human institution is the human heart, Ram Dass teaches. We can transform the universe by starting with our own individual human heart knowing that everyone we meet is your mirror for what lies within.
teaser: We can transform the universe by starting with our own individual human heart knowing that everyone we meet is your mirror for what lies within.

title: Shifting the Game
body: It only takes one consciousness to shift the game from reactivity to openness. Ram Dass describes the way an LSD-triggered shift in perception made him view his usual family dynamics with fresh eyes. Use this teaching as a prompt to shift your own life game.
teaser: It only takes one consciousness to shift the game from reactivity to openness. Use this teaching as a prompt to shift your own life game.

title: Relative Reality
body: Is the reality that we perceive absolutely real? Ram Dass explains that our waking consciousness is not the only reality we can experience. We can open the doors to many different levels of consciousness, and different levels of reality beyond this waking life.
teaser: Is the reality that we perceive absolutely real? Ram Dass explains that our waking consciousness is not the only reality we can experience.

title: Spirit Into Form
body: Each of us is a vehicle for bringing spirit into form. Ram Dass teaches that as we practice awareness of both our body and spirit, we bring light, peace, and presence into our daily lives, uniting our spiritual selves with the physical world.
teaser: Ram Dass teaches that as we practice awareness of both our body and spirit, we bring light, peace, and presence into our daily lives, uniting our spiritual selves with the physical world.

title: Creations of Mind
body: Everything we experience can be joyful, as the way we view the world shapes our satisfaction or dissatisfaction with it. Ram Dass reminds us that our collective reality changes with our expectations, and happiness comes from not how much you have, but how you are dwelling in your state of mind.
teaser: Ram Dass reminds us that our collective reality changes with our expectations, and happiness comes from not how much you have, but how you are dwelling in your state of mind.

title: Community of Common Good
body: How can we work toward a community of common good? Ram Dass explains that our spiritual work is to evolve a compassionate and just social structure where we are. The key is to focus on our individual connections, which build the larger conscious world.
teaser: How can we work toward a community of common good? Ram Dass explains that our spiritual work is to evolve a compassionate and just social structure where we are.

title: A Blueprint for Your Awakening
body: Our incarnation is a blueprint for our awakening, Ram Dass says. The karma of our actions leads to the dharma of our path, as we are continuously learning from our life circumstances. This means that we are always in the right place to learn and awaken to truth.
teaser: Our incarnation is a blueprint for our awakening, Ram Dass says. The karma of our actions leads to the dharma of our path, as we continuously learn from our life circumstances. This means that we are always in the right place to learn and awaken to truth.

title: A Matter of Faith
body: You have all the ingredients you need to realize your true nature, explains Ram Dass. In this teaching, he discusses how our sadhana, or spiritual practice, can lead to an enlightened state without the need to find wisdom outside of ourselves.
teaser: You have all the ingredients you need to realize your true nature, explains Ram Dass. In this teaching, he discusses how our sadhana, or spiritual practice, can lead to an enlightened state without the need to find wisdom outside of ourselves.

title: Good and Evil
body: Good is the force that awakens us to higher consciousness, and evil is the force of illusion. Ram Dass describes how as we raise our consciousness, we collectively learn to live in unity, and awaken out of illusion.
teaser: Good is the force that awakens us to higher consciousness, and evil is the force of illusion. Ram Dass describes how as we raise our consciousness, we collectively learn to live in unity, and awaken out of illusion.

title: Intuitive Listening
body: Our heart wisdom is more intuitive than our knowledge. Ram Dass teaches that there is no way to fall from your spiritual path, because your path is in everything you experience. As you learn to observe what is around you, your inner wisdom will continue to awaken.
teaser: Our heart wisdom is more intuitive than our knowledge. Ram Dass teaches that there is no way to fall from your spiritual path, because your path is in everything you experience.

title: It's All Yoga
body: Yoga is a practice of union. Ram Dass explains that wherever you are, you can bring awareness to the union of your physical world and your mental state. Focus your practice by being present within, no matter what happens.
teaser: Yoga is a practice of union. Ram Dass explains that wherever you are, you can bring awareness to the union of your physical world and your mental state.

title: Spiritual Practices
body: What is your spiritual practice? Ram Dass teaches that the spiritual practices we take in our lives may change, as we ourselves change through our lives. A practice like meditation or prayer takes us to the gate of liberation, and the work of awakening is always within us.
teaser: What is your spiritual practice? Ram Dass teaches that the spiritual practices we take in our lives may change, as we ourselves change. A practice like meditation or prayer takes us to the gate of liberation, and the work of awakening is always within us.

title: The Domain of Spirit
body: The domain of spirit is a place where we all belong. Ram Dass describes how we can move into spacious awareness, a place where we observe the beauty of everything as it is.
teaser: The domain of spirit is a place where we all belong. Ram Dass describes how we can move into spacious awareness, a place where we observe the beauty of everything as it is.

title: The Final Liberation
body: Have you realized who you truly are? In this meditation, Ram Dass shares teachings of what he calls the final liberation: existing beyond labels, and understanding that we each have the potential for divine awakening.
teaser: Have you realized who you truly are? In this meditation, Ram Dass shares teachings of what he calls the final liberation: existing beyond labels, and understanding that we each have the potential for divine awakening.

title: Willing to Grieve
body: We must honor the experiences that are behind us. Ram Dass describes the process of grieving as an initiation from one path to another, living each moment without denying the fragility of our lives and the grief of death.
teaser: Ram Dass describes the process of grieving as an initiation from one path to another, living each moment without denying the fragility of our lives and the grief of death.

title: The Guru
body: The guru, or teacher, is a doorway into mystery. Ram Dass explains how his guru opened a door of possibility for him to discover spiritual truths. As he moved to understanding his teacher's spiritual form, he realized that he could always be present in the light of his teacher's wisdom.
teaser: Ram Dass explains how his guru opened a door of possibility for him to discover spiritual truths. As he moved to understanding his teacher's spiritual form, he realized that he could always be present in the light of his teacher's wisdom.

title: Being With Dying
body: Part of the work of your lifetime is being present for dying. Ram Dass discusses his work in being present with people who are dying, and how being present for every moment means that we can face even our final life stage without regret or suffering.
teaser: Ram Dass discusses his work in being present with people who are dying, and how being present for every moment means that we can face even our final life stage without regret or suffering.

title: Embracing Our Humanity
body: The doorway to understanding our world is found in our own human experience. Ram Dass describes how taking a spiritual path means embracing our humanity. Every experience we have leads us to the reality of truth and love, expanding our consciousness of the order of the universe.
teaser: The doorway to understanding our world is found in our own human experience. Ram Dass describes how taking a spiritual path means embracing our humanity.

title: Finding Your Unique Manifestation
body: Each day, we can awaken fully to a world of changing phenomena. Ram Dass explains that while we may think that we have a clear path ahead of us, we need to be ready to find our own unique manifestation of our karma and dharma. This awakened awareness will bring us out of the illusion of separateness from the world.
teaser: Ram Dass explains that while we may think that we have a clear path ahead of us, we need to be ready to find our own unique manifestation of our karma and dharma.

title: From Reactive to Responsive
body: How can we live in a way that is responsive, rather than reactive? Ram Dass teaches that we can live in a reflective and responsive way to people around us. Rather than reacting immediately to negative events, with anger, fear, or irritation, we can give ourselves time to contemplate and respond in a way that is free of expectation.
teaser: How can we live in a way that is responsive, rather than reactive? Ram Dass teaches that we can live in a reflective and responsive way to people around us.

title: Live Fully in the Moment
body: Can we be conscious of everything around us when we live fully in each moment? Ram Dass teaches that by being present in the moment means we expand our awareness of the world and experience our reality as connected to everything in the cosmos. This awareness, or practice, he says, makes us truly free.
teaser: Can we be conscious of everything around us when we live fully in each moment? Ram Dass teaches that by being present in the moment means we expand our awareness of the world and experience our reality as connected to everything in the cosmos.

title: The World Is Your Ashram
body: The ashram is a community where we learn how to work, play, and live our lives with intention and focus. Ram Dass conveys that we can extend beyond the physical space of the ashram, and experience it within the world around us through mindfulness and meaning.
teaser: The ashram is a community where we learn how to work, play, and live our lives with intention and focus. We can extend beyond the physical space of the ashram, and experience it within the world around us through mindfulness and meaning.

title: Truth and Trust
body: Approaching liberation requires practicing trust in the process. Ram Dass describes how when we reach the state of a quiet mind, and open heart, and a strong body, we are closer to divine presence. This leads to a path of liberation from attachment.
teaser: Approaching liberation requires practicing trust in the process. Ram Dass describes how when we reach the state of a quiet mind, and open heart, and a strong body, we are closer to divine presence. T

title: True Identity
body: What is our true identity? Ram Dass explains how our "somebody training" leads us to define ourselves by someone else's terms. When we acknowledge the divine whole  each are a part of, we understand that our true identity is in how we live in connection, not in who we are expected to be.
teaser: What is our true identity? Ram Dass explains how our "somebody training" leads us to define ourselves by someone else's terms.

title: Faith
body: Experience comes and goes. Ram Dass uses the metaphor of flowers blooming in the morning to describe the way the way we experience moments of bliss or enlightenment. The practice of faith allows us to keep a constant perception of our true nature in connection to everything that exists.
teaser: The practice of faith allows us to keep a constant perception of our true nature in connection to everything that exists.

title: It's a Process
body: Each of us is in a unique situation. Ram Dass explains how observing the way things are can move us closer to our goals for intentional living. This process of attention to each moment allows us to harmonize our actions with those of others around us.
teaser: Ram Dass explains how observing the way things are can move us closer to our goals for intentional living. This process of attention to each moment allows us to harmonize our actions with those of others around us.

title: Keep It Human
body: Keeping connection at the human level brings us greater understanding of humanity. Ram Dass describes an anecdote of sharing sweetness from one human being to another. Seva (service) is one of our greatest gifts.
teaser: Keeping connection at the human level brings us greater understanding of humanity. Ram Dass describes a anecdote of sharing sweetness from one human being to another. Seva (service) is one of our greatest gifts.

title: Nobody Training
body: How attached are we to the roles we play? Ram Dass describes the meditative practice of moving beyond who we think we are, into being "nobody" instead of "somebody". This allows us to understand that we are not separate from anyone else we meet.
teaser: How attached are we to the roles we play? Ram Dass describes the meditative practice of moving beyond who we think we are.

title: On Drug Use and Society
body: Plant medicines and chemical drugs sometimes help people remove themselves from habits of thought to reach their spiritual potential. Ram Dass speaks about society can reach higher states of mind, with or without psychedelics. Ultimately, we cannot escape from our individual reality, but we can learn to be present with the true reality of how things are.
teaser: Ram Dass speaks about society can reach higher states of mind, with or without psychedelics. Ultimately, we cannot escape from our individual reality, but we can learn to be present with the true reality of how things are.

title: Responding to Suffering
body: We are each part of a web of compassion. Ram Dass explains that as we learn to see our connection to others, we will respond to suffering by listening and understanding that our karma (action) is limited by the actions that we can take. If we each "do our dharma," we are in the best pathway possible.
teaser: We are each part of a web of compassion. Ram Dass explains that as we learn to see our connection to others, we will respond to suffering we see by listening before we respond.

title: Such a Delicate Dance
body: Never put another human being out of your heart. Ram Dass explains that we need to view people as they are, rather than the way they should be. The delicate dance is in our ability to stay in the present moment and appreciate what is happening with each person we meet.
teaser: Never put another human being out of your heart. Ram Dass explains that we need to view people as they are, rather than the way they should be.

title: Taste This Moment
body: We often hold an internal model of what we expect from our experiences. Ram Dass guides a meditation practice for awareness of where we are, in this present moment, letting go of our expectations.
teaser: Ram Dass guides a meditation practice for awareness of where we are, in this present moment.

title: The Edge of the Mystery
body: How do we deal with the unknown? Ram Dass describes how we can empty our minds to find answers to the mysteries of suffering and death. We can be grounded in observing, watching, and listening to what is around us.
teaser: How do we deal with the unknown? Ram Dass describes how we can empty our minds to find answers to the mysteries of suffering and death.

title: The Family of Compassion
body: How can we keep a compassionate heart? Ram Dass speaks about how we can consciously reach out to others. Compassionate action allows us to think beyond our own wishing and needs, understanding that we can still be open to the universe, and act within a web of compassion.
teaser: How can we keep a compassionate heart? Ram Dass speaks about how we can consciously reach out to others, feeling and understanding our connections to them.

title: The Forgetting is the Remembering
body: We are connected to everyone and everything in the universe. Ram Dass explains that in the moments when we forget these connections, we can be drawn back again and again to remember, and live in awareness of our unity with others.
teaser: We are connected to everyone and everything in the universe. Ram Dass explains that when we forget these connections, we can be drawn back again and again to remember, and live in awareness.

title: The Living Truth
body: Do you want to know the truth? Ram Dass shares how we can reach a clear connection with the people in our lives, and live in truth, instead of in reactions and projections about one another. When we see one another clearly, we are capable of greater compassion with everyone we meet.
teaser: Do you want to know the truth? Ram Dass shares how we can reach a clear connection with the people in our lives, and live in truth, instead of in reactions and projections about one another.

title: The State of Your Being
body: We each have an infinite, unchanging nature, as our true selves transcend our personalities. Ram Dass describes how we can let go of our attachments to our feelings about our individual circumstances. The real state of our being is beyond our limited individual understanding.
teaser: Ram Dass describes how we can let go of our attachments to our feelings about our individual circumstances. The real state of our being is beyond our limited individual understanding.

title: Awakening From the Illusion
body: Being ripped away from illusion can be painful. Ram Dass relates how we can wake up, individually, and collectively, from the illusion that we are separate beings. When we realize our connection to every other being, we can also let go of our experiences of suffering, and live in relation to the whole universe.
teaser: Being ripped away from illusion can be painful. Ram Dass relates how we can wake up, individually, and collectively, from the illusion that we are separate beings.

title: Fellow Addicts
body: Finding joy in the everyday moments of life is not always easy. Ram Dass shares how examining our minds, supporting others, and opening our hearts to abundance and compassion brings about the safety to love openly. Breaking addictive cycles of heartbreak can lead us to “the living truth” and help us realize our potential to love limitlessly and live freely.
teaser: Finding joy in the everyday moments of life is not always easy. Ram Dass shares how examining our minds, supporting others, and opening our hearts to abundance and compassion brings about the safety to love openly.

title: Mantra
body: A mantra is a seed teaching that we can repeat in our daily practice to connect to our purpose. Ram Dass describes the power of mantra practice and the mantras that we choose. In a journey to Tibet, he discovered how "Om Mani Padme Hum" represents a connection to other practitioners across time.
teaser: A mantra is a seed teaching that we can repeat in our daily practice to connect to our purpose. Ram Dass describes the power of mantra practice and the mantras that we choose.

title: Right Effort
body: There is a paradox in practicing right effort, Ram Dass explains. When we balance effort and no effort, we reach an effortless state where "things are done without doing".
teaser: There is a paradox in practicing right effort, Ram Dass explains. When we balance effort and no effort, we reach a state where "things are done without doing".

title: Self Judgment
body: Can we be impartial in how we view ourselves? Ram Dass explains how looking at our own circumstances without self judgment is like appreciating the individual trees in a forest. The differences in each tree are what build the whole forest we see.
teaser: Can we be impartial in how we view ourselves? Ram Dass explains how looking at our own circumstances without self judgment is like appreciating the individual trees in a forest. The differences in each tree are what build the whole forest we see.

title: The Mother
body: One of the ways we experience the universe is through the symbol of the Mother. Ram Dass describes how divine figures like Kali, Lakshmi, and Mother Mary help us understand our soul origins and experiences on our Earth. The divine mother energy brings us back to the present moment, and helps us to experience the end of suffering.
teaser: One of the ways we experience the universe is through the symbol of the Mother. Ram Dass describes how figures like Kali, Lakshmi, and Mother Mary help us understand our soul origins and experiences.

title: Appreciate and Allow
body: Can we appreciate the universe, and ourselves, perfectly as they are? Ram Dass speaks about how accepting ourselves more leads us to a better understanding of everyone we meet. The spiritual component of life is to see everything in the universe as it is, and appreciate the truth of the way things are.
teaser: Can we appreciate the universe, and ourselves, perfectly as they are? Ram Dass speaks about how accepting ourselves more leads us to a better understanding of everyone we meet.

title: Desire and the Path
body: Can we give up identifying with the desires that drive our lives? Ram Dass describes the process to "go behind your thoughts" and let go of the suffering that we each find in the course of our lives.
teaser: Can we give up identifying with the desires that drive our lives? Ram Dass describes the process to "go behind your thoughts" and let go of the suffering that we each find in the course of our lives.

title: Sky Gazing & Soul Awareness
body: Observing the vastness of the sky gives us insight on the depth of our soul connections. Ram Dass describes the meditative practice of sky gazing in the Dzogchen tradition: as you look at the sky, you can observe the freshness of the present moment.
teaser: Observing the vastness of the sky gives us insight on the depth of our soul connections. Ram Dass describes the meditative practice of sky gazing in the Dzogchen tradition: as you look at the sky, you can observe the freshness of the present moment.
